cyclone.name: ARLENE
cyclone.current_location: about 305 miles WNW of Ft. Myers, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn south on Friday and accelerate slowly south-southwestward, moving farther into the central Gulf and away from the U.S. Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No U.S. landfall expected – system likely to dissipate or reach the Yucatán vicinity as a weak low

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Portions of the east-central Gulf well south of Alabama and the Florida Peninsula; Mobile coast is not in the impact zone
weather_observation.wind: Small chance (≤7%) of brief tropical-storm-force gusts; otherwise breezy but sub-gale conditions expected
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Mobile Bay given southward track away from coast
weather_observation.rainfall: No significant rainfall associated with ARLENE forecast for Mobile, AL
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minimal maritime disruption; slight seas increase offshore but harbor operations largely unaffected
